content.question: Which of the following developments most directly contributed to the events described in the excerpt?

choices.label: Protestant evangelism came to the colonies from Great Britain and Europe.
The beliefs of Puritan leaders had an increased impact on colonial religious practices.
Colonists became less interested in religion as they became more involved with trans-Atlantic trade.
Local clergy members in the colonies routinely welcomed the preaching of diverse religious doctrines.

content.answer: Protestant evangelism came to the colonies from Great Britain and Europe.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify a historical concept, development, or process.
